text:
Are you looking for a native solution? What Hubs/tiers are in play? If you are comfortable with a custom approach, you could write a function that:
1. Understands the contact that’s logged in.
2. Calls custom objects/fields/content that is specific to the contact’s profile (a status, uploaded files, etc).
3. Displays the information in a template of your choosing.
 -This is a simplification, but it shouldn’t be too difficult to build.

As for a native solution, maybe there’s a workaround you could explore using content personalization rules.

Hi everyone! I’m the Product Manager who oversees our Memberships functionality. I have an EXCITING ANNOUNCEMENT! As of today, Memberships is….
:one: Moving off lists onto a new access management object called “Access Groups” (for new customers only, existing customers will be migrated later this year). More information about access groups <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/manage-membership-for-private-content|here>.
:two: *AVAILABLE IN PRO!* :tada:

More information can be found on our pricing and packaging page <https://www.HubSpot.com/pricing/content/enterprise?term=annual|here>. If you have any questions, feel free to shoot me a note at <mailto:angupta@HubSpot.com|angupta@HubSpot.com>
